means: 快乐的，好交际的，善良快活的

sentence.Network_en: Jovial ladies chivvy you into ordering more than you can eat!
sentence.Network_cn: 热情的女招待会一再推荐，最后点的餐多到吃不下!

sentence.Network_en: When we next met, he was much more jovial.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们再次见面时，他愉快多了。

sentence.Network_en: He was falsely jovial, with his booming, mirthless laugh.
sentence.Network_cn: 他低声苦笑了几声，装出快乐的样子。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from French, from late Latin jovialis 'of Jupiter' (see Jove), with reference to the supposed influence of the planet Jupiter on those born under it

entry.def: If you describe a person as jovial, you mean that they are happy and behave in a cheerful way.

example.ex: Father Whittaker appeared to be in a jovial mood...
example.tran: 惠特克神父看起来心情非常好。
祖母身材圆胖，整天乐呵呵的。

means.word_mean: 1. full of or showing high-spirited merriment;

sentences.sentence: "a poet could not but be gay, in such a jocund company"- Wordsworth

auth_sentence.content: The jovial Harding had vetoed only six bills.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: The jovial Harding had vetoed only six bills.

auth_sentence.content: "Well, I hope not" was her jovial response.

auth_sentence.content: With this, she put a jovial arm around my neck.
